data.text:
When Lora Lee Olmstead was born on 4 October 1882, in Tazewell, Illinois, United States, his father, Harmon Camp Olmstead, was 50 and his mother, Rebecca Levonia Lee, was 36. He married Edith Adeline Nelson on 26 February 1908, in Rapid City, Pennington, South Dakota, United States. They were the parents of at least 4 sons and 4 daughters. He lived in Plummer, Benewah, Idaho, United States in 1942 and Benewah, Benewah, Idaho, United States in 1950. In 1942, at the age of 60, his occupation is listed as wl boutillier logging company in Plummer, Benewah, Idaho, United States. He died on 1 March 1953, in St. Maries, Benewah, Idaho, United States, at the age of 70, and was buried in St. Maries, Benewah, Idaho, United States.

1901 Â· Assassination of Mckinley

President William McKinley was shot at the Temple of Music, in the Pan-American Exposition, while shaking hands with the public. Leon Czolgosz shot him twice in the abdomen because he thought it was his duty to do so. McKinley died after eight days of watch and care. He was the third American president to be assassinated. After his death, Congress passed legislation to officially make the Secret Service and gave them responsibility for protecting the President at all times.
